name: Moira Brown

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Could you come back in an hour or two? Even geniuses need their sleep.{very sleepy}

topics.topic_text: I hear you're the person to see about buying stuff for my house.
topics.response_text: Good to see that old house finally found an owner.

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me what the items do?
topics.response_text: Of course I can!

topics.topic_text: Tell me about your Themes.
topics.response_text: Some people don't like living in a boring old house.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to change my house's Theme.
topics.response_text: Okay, consider it done. Anything else?

topics.topic_text: Okay, let me take a look at your stuff.
topics.response_text: Sure thing!

topics.topic_text: Enough about the house. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Okay.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the My First Infirmary.
topics.response_text: If you're wounded or you've hurt one of your limbs badly, this setup will allow you to heal it up as good as any other Wasteland Doctor.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the Jukebox.
topics.response_text: If you feel like filling your place with a whole bunch of music, switch this beautiful pre-war antique on.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the My First Laboratory.
topics.response_text: This setup is great for experimenting and coming up with all sorts of useful concoctions.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the Nuka-Cola Machine.
topics.response_text: One push of a button and you can get your hands on an Ice Cold Nuka-Cola!

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the Workbench.
topics.response_text: If you feel like tinkering and want to build some custom gizmos, this setup will help you do it.

topics.topic_text: That's enough about the items.
topics.response_text: Sounds good.

topics.topic_text: I'm interested in the Vault Theme.
topics.response_text: Feeling a bit homesick are we?

topics.topic_text: I'm interested in the Raider Theme.
topics.response_text: Into the blood and guts look, eh?

topics.topic_text: I'm interested in the Wasteland Explorer Theme.
topics.response_text: Longing for the great outdoors are we?

topics.topic_text: I'm interested in the Science Theme.
topics.response_text: You're the intellectual type, eh?

topics.topic_text: I'm interested in the Pre-War Theme.
topics.response_text: Feeling a bit nostalgic are we?

topics.topic_text: I'm interested in the Love Machine Theme.
topics.response_text: Feeling a bit anxious are we?

topics.topic_text: Let me ask about something else.
topics.response_text: Sure.

topics.topic_text: Actually, let me pick another Theme.
topics.response_text: Go right ahead!

topics.topic_text: Sounds good to me.
topics.response_text: Well then, let's make a deal!

topics.topic_text: LamplightHolotape1
topics.response_text: My name is Carrie Delaney. I teach fourth grade at the Early Dawn Elementary School, in Washington, D.C.{doing an audio journal, and really shaken up/afraid}

topics.topic_text: LamplightHolotape2
topics.response_text: We're all okay. If you can call being stuck in a cave with 82 terrified kids okay. Alive, anyway. But I don't know what the hell we're going to do.{doing an audio journal, and really shaken up/afraid}

topics.topic_text: What do you know about Minefield?
topics.response_text: They say it was a town called Ridgefield, until slavers cleared it out. Now, it's supposedly cursed, and just a deathtrap to visitors.{Spooky, like telling a campfire story}

topics.topic_text: No need to test that theory. I've already found food and medicine there.
topics.response_text: I guess you've been around a bit! So, tell me about what you found!

topics.topic_text: I'm already incredibly irradiated. Can't you tell?
topics.response_text: Really? Oh, how convenient!

topics.topic_text: No need to bother testing this. I've already been to Minefield.
topics.response_text: Really? Wow, tell me all about it? Did you get blown up?

topics.topic_text: Why get myself hurt? I'm a good enough doctor to explain this part for you.
topics.response_text: That'll save a lot of time and effort. Oh, and blood, on your part. A real-world example might help more, but I won't turn down the help!

topics.topic_text: Hold on. I need to know more before I agree to anything.
topics.response_text: Well, it's a dangerous place out there in the Wastes, right? People could really use a compilation of good advice. Like a Wasteland survival guide!

topics.topic_text: Wait. How? I mean, how many people even read anymore?
topics.response_text: Anyone who wants to learn from my Wasteland survival guide, that's who! And for that, I need a research assistant who can test my ideas for the book.

topics.topic_text: Pay? What sort of pay? And what sort of work?
topics.response_text: Let's see, dealing with radiation, testing an experimental device, and I won't lie, it may include some reading. That sort of stuff, you know?

topics.topic_text: It's tempting, but I'll have to pass.
topics.response_text: Well, you do what you have to, I suppose. But the offer'll still be open, if you change your mind.

topics.topic_text: Sounds good. Tell me more.
topics.response_text: Well, it's a dangerous place out there in the Wastes, right? People could really use a compilation of good advice. Like a Wasteland Survival Guide!

topics.topic_text: Not interested. I'm just here to do some shopping.
topics.response_text: Well, okay, I guess. But I promise, you'll love it when you hear about the guide. Maybe later, huh?

topics.topic_text: What's this book you're working on?
topics.response_text: Well, it's a dangerous place out there in the Wastes, right? People could really use a compilation of good advice. Like a Wasteland Survival Guide!

topics.topic_text: How's the book coming?
topics.response_text: I'm still working out the kinks in the first chapter. I'm calling it, "Survive."

topics.topic: MS03MoiraGhoul1AThe bomb in town just blew up! You're lucky to be alive!
topics.topic_text: The bomb in town just blew up. You're lucky to be alive!
topics.response_text: Wow! Who would have thought a town built around a bomb could be so dangerous?{Honestly surprised, and naive as hell.}

topics.topic_text: I have no idea. I wasn't even here. <Lie.>
topics.response_text: Same here! I had just gone down to Springvale to do some tests  turns out you can't teach a giant ant new tricks  and before I knew it, boom!{turns out the ants can't be taught tricks is an aside, as if she expects the player is really interested in her experiments}

topics.topic_text: I blew up your town. Maybe you shouldn't have built it around a bomb.
topics.response_text: Don't be silly, why would you blow up our town? You're talking crazy-talk.{Dismissive "pfft!" noise at the start}

topics.topic_text: How odd. It appears that the burst of radiation has turned you into a Ghoul.
topics.response_text: Oh my goodness! Do you really think so? I'm becoming a Ghoul?! This is... This is...{Incredulous, uncertain between horror or excitement}

topics.topic_text: Moira, don't take this the wrong way, but you got ugly real fast.
topics.response_text: Don't be silly, I just got some gunk on my face after the explosion... but that doesn't explain why it peels away in strips. And oozes.{Dismissive, but slowly dawning fear}

topics.topic_text: There's an entire Ghoul community in Underworld, downtown.
topics.response_text: Really? Then I guess I'll be heading there, to join my newfound family and their warm, smiling, and hideously pockmarked faces.

topics.topic_text: Seems to me like that isn't my problem, stickyface.
topics.response_text: Huh. I guess you're right. Well, this seems like the perfect excuse to do some of that downtown exploring I've kept putting off.

topics.topic_text: It was a job. Sorry, nothing personal.
topics.response_text: Well, okay, as long as you're sorry. But I expect you to apologize to everyone else in town, okay? And don't do it again!{like a scolding school-teacher}

topics.topic_text: Who needs a reason? Explosions are pretty.
topics.response_text: Yeah, they really are, aren't they?{Kind of lost in thought at the mention of pretty explosions. End with a dreamy sigh.}

topics.topic_text: I was trying to shut you up for good. Now I'll have to finish the job.
topics.response_text: Wait, what?

topics.topic_text: Moira? Is that you? You don't look so good.
topics.response_text: Oh, that's a real nice thing to say. Of course it's me!{A little insulted about being told she doesn't look very good.}

topics.topic_text: What do you do here?
topics.response_text: Why, I'm an inventor, a tinkerer, and a general genius of junk. One person's junk is another's treasure, you know.

topics.topic_text: I've been thinking about your experiments. Can I ask you something personal?
topics.response_text: Why, I'm flattered! What would you like to know?

topics.topic_text: That'll do.
topics.response_text: Fine by me. I'm always glad to talk!

topics.topic_text: Let me guess. You need me to go print and distribute it, right?
topics.response_text: So cynical! No, no, I can take care of all that with a few traders I know. What makes you think I'd force you to handle something so dangerous?{Playfully scolding.}

topics.topic_text: Sounds like a great idea! I can't wait to help!
topics.response_text: Good enthusiasm! Now, I think the first chapter will have to be about surviving day-to-day dangers.

topics.topic_text: Okay, I guess I'll help with this "Survival Guide."
topics.response_text: All right, then! Now, I think the first chapter will have to be about surviving day-to-day dangers.

topics.topic_text: I'm afraid I'm going to have to pass. Sorry.
topics.response_text: But, don't you like the idea? I mean, it's a good idea, right?

topics.topic_text: Hell no, crazy girl. I won't be your lab rat.
topics.response_text: What? Really? But... Please?

topics.topic_text: It was hardly any work at all. How's it look?
topics.response_text: Looks good! I mean, it could be better, but nothing's perfect. And it's not like bad advice ever hurt anyone, right?

topics.topic_text: I'm just glad I can stop getting stabbed, irradiated, and shot for your science.
topics.response_text: I know it was a lot to ask, but we made a great piece! And it's bound to help humanity, you know.

topics.topic_text: Tell me more about the pay.
topics.response_text: Oh, caps, chems, meds, and maybe even a few unique inventions, if you do a good job. I'm sure I've got something that'll catch your eye.

topics.topic_text: Fear not! With my vast scientific knowledge, I explain this one myself.
topics.response_text: Oh, but nothing beats a real-world example. And I have a new rad treatment I was just itching to try out on a live subject!

topics.topic_text: Okay, I can tell how much it means to you. Let's get this book finished.
topics.response_text: Really? You really mean that? You think my book really could help humanity?{As if very sad but just offered a glimpse of hope.}

topics.topic_text: Yes, I really do.
topics.response_text: Well... Thanks. That really means a lot to me, you know?{Comforted}

topics.topic_text: No. It's a terrible idea. Don't even try.
topics.response_text: But! But! But!{As if stunned by the player's betrayal.}

topics.topic_text: Why do you really want to write this guide?
topics.response_text: Well, it'll help humanity rebuild, right? I mean, who doesn't want to help humanity?

topics.topic_text: Well, it's a big undertaking, and we've got to make sure we do it right.
topics.response_text: Oh, believe me, I know! I've been a bit careless with other projects, but this... This is important! This means something!{This is important! This means something! part should be spoken in the manner of Close Encounters of the Third Kind.}

topics.topic_text: What do you mean about your other projects? Have there been problems?
topics.response_text: Well, a little before you first arrived, one of my experiments had a little accident.{Hesitant pause before "accident".}

topics.topic_text: I think you're right. Now, let's get back to work on this book!
topics.response_text: You got it, super research assistant! Hey, I should get you a costume or something!

topics.topic_text: Okay, but it could be bad if the book's misleading. People could get hurt.
topics.response_text: Oh, I hadn't really thought about it like that. I don't want anyone to get hurt. That's the last thing the guide should do!

topics.topic: MS03ReasonForGuide3CMoira, please don't write the book. It will just turn out badly.
topics.topic_text: This really isn't a good idea. Please don't write it. It'll just turn out badly.
topics.response_text: You... You really think so? But I thought I was so brilliant...

topics.topic_text: Why can't you do this research yourself?
topics.response_text: Oh, I haven't got nearly the experience in the Wastes that you do. If I tried half of these things, I'd get my head blown off!

topics.topic_text: It's really good of you to try to help people like this.
topics.response_text: I know, right? I figured, instead of just helping out the caravans with odd junk, why not put my brilliant mind to work for everyone?

topics.topic_text: It sounds like you don't know what you're doing.
topics.response_text: I know exactly what I'm doing. I'm trying to help mankind survive and rebuild! It's important, and I need your help.

topics.topic_text: Well, I'm proud to be a part of it. You can count on me!
topics.response_text: That's the spirit, trusty research assistant!

topics.topic_text: I don't know. Those caravans help a lot of people.
topics.response_text: Well, I guess they do bring important supplies here and there. But still, I can help out so much more than the boring old stuff they do.

topics.topic_text: Seriously, don't waste time with this book. Stick to helping the caravans.
topics.response_text: I... Well... Okay.

topics.topic_text: Why are you always working on such weird ideas?
topics.response_text: Well, look around at the world we live in. It may be okay to you, but I've read about what it used to be like, and this wasn't it.

topics.topic_text: I don't understand. Crazy experiments are what keep you going?
topics.response_text: No. It's like... Did you ever try to put a broken piece of glass back together? Even if the pieces fit, you can't make it whole again the way it was.{Hesitatingly, having trouble putting her feelings into words.}

topics.topic_text: But why do you waste your talents on this garbage?
topics.response_text: It's not garbage! But don't be fooled - it is junk. It's just that junk's pretty important stuff, you know?{Emphasis on the "IS" on "it is junk."}

topics.topic_text: So you're trying to make the world better than it was?
topics.response_text: Hey, it sounds crazy when you say it that way, but that's what I'm aiming for, yeah.

topics.topic_text: I don't know. Human nature doesn't change like that.
topics.response_text: Maybe. I've certainly heard people say that. But isn't it also human nature to try to do better than we always have?

topics.topic_text: But why try with this book, when you could be helping out in real ways here?
topics.response_text: What, helping the trade caravans with idiotic chores? Repairing carts and fixing up sick Brahmin?

topics.topic_text: You don't have the experience for a book like this. You'll be a laughingstock.
topics.response_text: But that's why I'm getting your help! I know my flaws, and with your help, we can make something great for the world!

topics.topic_text: It will just get us hurt. You don't want to hurt anyone, do you?
topics.response_text: No... No, you're right, I don't. I mean, I've already gotten you hurt a couple times, haven't I?

topics.topic_text: What's Rivet City?
topics.response_text: Oh, it's this huge city on a ship where the river meets downtown! It's been around for as long as I can remember. You should really check it out.

topics.topic_text: I could just write that section for you. Trust me  I'm an expert.
topics.response_text: Practically speak robot, do you? As long as you don't write it all in ones and zeroes, then I guess it'll be fine. Thanks!

topics.topic_text: I guess I can check the Super-Duper Mart again.
topics.response_text: Oh, great! Food is most important, but see if you can get medicine, too. And if there's nothing to find, then just come back in one piece, okay?

topics.topic_text: I suppose nothing beats a real-world example. I'll get myself irradiated.
topics.response_text: Now, that's the adventurous scientific spirit! Go on out there and get good and fried!

topics.topic_text: Nothing beats a real-world example, they say. I'll get myself injured.
topics.response_text: There's my brave research assistant! Go out and get bashed up. For the good of mankind!

topics.topic_text: I don't think I want to do that one.
topics.response_text: Okay, so where'd you like to start?

topics.topic_text: I'm ready to begin researching the book, now.
topics.response_text: Well, I think the first chapter will have to be about surviving day-to-day dangers.

topics.topic_text: I'm taking a break from the research.
topics.response_text: Don't take to long. The sooner the book's done, the more people we can save with it!

topics.topic_text: Well, I've got the food. But no luck with the medicine.
topics.response_text: Really? No medicine at all? None? Seriously? Well, I guess I should have expected that. It's been a long time, after all.

topics.topic_text: It's got a lot more food than most places, but I wasn't the only one there.
topics.response_text: It makes sense that there'd be a few Raiders there. But if that's the only concern, that hardly makes it worse than anywhere else out there.

topics.topic_text: I encountered some Raiders, but they were easily outsmarted.
topics.response_text: Guess I wasn't the first to think of checking out a food store for storing food. Huh?

topics.topic_text: I got the food and dealt with those pansy Raiders. They couldn't stop me.
topics.response_text: That's a mighty callous attitude towards killing. But I guess they'd do the same for the food. Shame there wasn't any medicine.

topics.topic_text: Those big, shadowy stores can be great for hiding out.
topics.response_text: Oh my, Raiders had set up camp there? I'm guessing you didn't just negotiate with them, did you?

topics.topic_text: That place was a death trap. It was crawling with Raiders.
topics.response_text: Oh, poor research assistant! I'm sorry, I didn't know it'd be so dangerous in there!{Sincere, not mocking.}

topics.topic_text: It wasn't easy, but I got the food and the medicine.
topics.response_text: Really? You did? You did! Well, all right! Tell me all about it!

topics.topic_text: I found Raiders and a robot. It was hardly a safe place to scavenge.
topics.response_text: Whoa! Really? Raiders and robots! I guess I wasn't the only one to think about checking those stores. Looks like you gotta be careful looting them.

topics.topic_text: The Raiders were using the pharmacy as a place to store their best gear.
topics.response_text: So, you're saying that they acquired a well-protected stash? I wonder how many other places are hiding treasures behind monsters, hrm?

topics.topic_text: Those Raiders must've shot me twenty times. But who's counting?
topics.response_text: You do what you need to do to get food and medicine, I guess. It's not pretty, but I guess that's the way it's got to be, right?

topics.topic_text: It's very hard to talk my way past that many people shooting at me...
topics.response_text: Oh, dear. Well, I guess the dangers around those old supplies keeps it from being smooth sailing. Otherwise, they'd already have been looted, huh?

topics.topic_text: I had a fun party with some Raiders. Then a guard robot jumped out of a cake.
topics.response_text: Well as long as it was no problem for you, then! I mean, who doesn't enjoy cake? Other than robots, of course. I bet they prefer pie. Or maybe pi?{Lea doesn't get the sarcasm in the player's statement.}

topics.topic_text: Getting food doesn't sound so bad. What are you looking for?
topics.response_text: Well, food and medicine. Everyone needs them once in a while, right? So they need a good place to find them!

topics.topic_text: What's this about radiation?
topics.response_text: Well, I know lots about radiation from books... and personal experience, obviously.{A little sheepish}

topics.topic_text: Let's hear more about the landmines.
topics.response_text: Landmines are one of the few dangers out there that you can profit from. Disarm one before it blows, and you can sell it for plenty of caps.

topics.topic_text: I went into Minefield and came back, no problem. <Lie.>
topics.response_text: There's no way you could have gone there and gotten back already.

topics.topic_text: I haven't gotten around to it, yet.
topics.response_text: Oh. Well, could you get on that? Thanks!

topics.topic_text: I'll do it when I get around to it, all right?
topics.response_text: No, not all right. Every day you don't help with this research is another day people might die!{Whining}

topics.topic_text: Actually, I'll have to wait a bit.
topics.response_text: Well, I guess I can wait a little. I've got plenty of other projects to work on, after all.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about collecting the stuff from Super-Duper Mart...
topics.response_text: So, how's the scavving been? Got the food and medicine from that Super-Duper Mart?{Scavving is pronounced with a short "a" - it's an abbreviation of "scavenging"}

topics.topic_text: What's the pay?
topics.response_text: Hopefully, you'll be finding food and medicine, but I could sweeten the deal by paying more food when you get back, regardless of the results.

topics.topic_text: You want me to get irradiated? How could that possibly be worth it for me?
topics.response_text: Oh, don't worry so much about it. I'll be waiting here with a nice, tall glass of rad-cleansing brahmin milk for you when you get back.

topics.topic_text: That seems kind of... unhealthy. How will you make it worth my while?
topics.response_text: What better reward for avoiding explosives than to pay you with explosives? Frag grenades, in this case. I got a pretty good haul of them recently.

topics.topic_text: That completes the first chapter's tasks, correct?
topics.response_text: Yup, you've done a great job! I just need to add in the section on how to cook rat, and this chapter's done.

topics.topic_text: Sure, I've got plenty to say about life in the Vault.
topics.response_text: Great! Just tell me what it's like to live underground all your life, or to come outside for the first time, or whatever strikes your fancy!

topics.topic_text: Where'd you get the Vault Suit back there?
topics.response_text: I'm pretty sure I remember a girl coming into town with that about ten, twelve years ago.

topics.topic_text: It was paradise down there. No fear, no worries, no fighting... Until Dad left.
topics.response_text: A runaway dad, huh? I've seen plenty of them before. But none with a big "101" on their back.

topics.topic_text: This "Outside" place is amazing. In the main room, I can't even see the ceiling!
topics.response_text: Hah! Yeah, you wouldn't imagine how hard it is to replace that big light bulb up there, too!{Joking along}

topics.topic_text: I was sent as an ambassador from the utopia of Vault 101. Bow before my glory!
topics.response_text: Oh, certainly, your majesty! Allow me to humbly welcome you to the, um, Duchy of Megaton.{Not entirely sure she believes him, but playing along, half for fun, and half just in case.}

topics.topic_text: How do you people live out here? I haven't found a food dispenser anywhere!
topics.response_text: Well, it takes a little more work than that to get food. And good water's even harder. But you'll figure that out soon enough.

topics.topic_text: It was cramped, dark, and the food sucked. Good riddance.
topics.response_text: That's terrible!

topics.topic_text: No, I don't want anything to do with them anymore.
topics.response_text: If you say so. But if you really mean that, you might want to stop wearing a suit with their number writ large across the back.

topics.topic_text: Do you know anything about an android from the Commonwealth?
topics.response_text: Something about facial surgery and reprogramming its memory. But that seems to have been a hoax. Haven't heard anything about it in a long time.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about the android from the Commonwealth?
topics.response_text: Have you heard the so called "android recording?" It sounds like an ordinary man! Here's a spare copy of that old holotape. It's a hoax for sure.{doubting the rumors}

topics.topic_text: You know anything about the mind wipe on that escaped android?
topics.response_text: Some say it was all a hoax. But it's real. Here. Check out this holotape I found. That Commonwealth robot was real!{bragging that he's in the know}

topics.topic_text: Got any info on an android mind wipe? Here's a 100 cap "research fee."
topics.response_text: Some say it was all a hoax. But it's real. Here. Check out this holotape I found. That Commonwealth robot was real!{bragging that he's in the know}

topics.topic_text: You know how they rewrote engrams in a cluster of Android memory subroutines?
topics.response_text: Some say it was all a hoax. But it's real. Here. Check out this holotape I found. That Commonwealth robot was real!{bragging that he's in the know}

topics.topic_text: Do you know who did the memory transfer on the escaped android?
topics.response_text: Heard a rumor a while back that it was some guy named Pinkerton at Rivet City. Apparently he's got some sweet tech stashed on that boat.{bragging that he is in the know}

topics.topic_text: I'll give you 100 caps if you know who did the mind wipe on that android.
topics.response_text: Heard a rumor a while back that it was some guy named Pinkerton at Rivet City. Apparently he's got some sweet tech stashed on that boat.{bragging that he is in the know}

topics.topic_text: Do you know anything about the AI swap on that Commonwealth android?
topics.response_text: Heard a rumor a while back that it was some guy named Pinkerton at Rivet City. Apparently he's got some sweet tech stashed on that boat.{bragging that he is in the know}

topics.topic_text: Have you thought about disarming the bomb?
topics.response_text: Oh, I couldnÆt do that! ItÆd be a real blow to those nice folks in the Church.{talking nonchalantly about an undetonated bomb}

topics.topic_text: Let me see what you have for sale.
topics.response_text: Sorry, I'm closed. Come back tomorrow and we'll talk.

topics.topic_text: Can you repair my equipment?
topics.response_text: Sorry, I'm closed. Come back tomorrow and we'll talk.

topics.topic_text: Do you sell any specialty items?
topics.response_text: Do I ever! I've got the schematics for something called a Rock-It Launcher. I sell all the components, too, so you can make the weapon yourself.

topics.topic_text: That's all I needed to know.
topics.response_text: No problem!

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: Well, I'll just have to prove you wrong, then! Now let's get back to work!

conversation.response_text: Okay, a little Brahmin milk... A couple magnets... And maybe a few happy thoughts...
Hey, now. That's my stuff. If you want something, you gotta buy it.
Oh, heya Nathan. Sorry, I got lost in my work. What do you need?{ }
Hrm. Let me think... you know, I don't think so. But I'll let you know if anyone sells me one.

combat.response_text: You should probably leave, you know.{A little surprised and annoyed}
I can't believe you'd do that!

description:
Moira Brown is a 24 year-old Caucasian Female.

A self-styled inventor and owner of Craterside Supply in Megaton, Moira is a curious and optimistic individual who spends her days reading, conducting experiments, and trading supplies. Despite her extensive knowledge from books, she has limited real-world experience and a somewhat naive view of the dangers of the wasteland.

Moira Brown's Personality: Optimistic, curious, enthusiastic, and somewhat naive. Moira always tries to see the bright side of life and is driven by a desire to improve the lives of her fellow wastelanders. She can be persuaded to adopt a more realistic perspective, but generally maintains her cheerful demeanor.

Moira Brown's Backstory: Moira grew up in the trading community of Canterbury Commons, where she developed an uncommon curiosity about the world. Before 2263, she moved to Megaton, where she established Craterside Supply. She spends her days reading books that come through town via traders and caravans, absorbing as much knowledge as possible. Her love of reading has taught her a great deal, but she lacks practical understanding of how to apply this knowledge outside of her workshop or Megaton itself.
